page.title: 07Old Bidston (cont.)
page.content: smuggling,when men crossed from {Wallasey}to what is now the M53 motorway.Bidston Hall first came into the hands of the{Vyner}family in the late 17th century. {Sir Robert Vyner}was the creator of many of the regalia now used in coronations.For this he was paid the fortune of Â£31,978 in 1680.The same family also built a 22ft cockpit for sport,which still stands near the hall.The hall was restored in the 1960's and is still a family home. Regarding schools,evidence from a will suggests a school existed before 1603. A school was built in 1636 and then again in{Hoylake Road}in 1837.This school still stands.The old school building was destroyed on 13th March 1941 by German incendiary bombs.Now the site houses two new buildings.
